intro: Eriogonum artificis, commonly known as the artificial goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments. Eriogonum artificis is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
